member.summary: Create a new data entry

member.summary: String used as property name of the generated entry. Will be filtered through reserved name and C# compliance checks

member.name: P:TypeSafe.Editor.TypeSafeDataEntry.Parameters
member.summary: The array of parameters passed to the data type constructor. If the data type is a primitive or string, this should have one entry of the exact same type.

member.summary: Create a new data unit

member.summary: Create a new data unit

member.name: P:TypeSafe.Editor.TypeSafeDataUnit.ClassName
member.summary: Class name that TypeSafe will use for your generated class.

member.name: P:TypeSafe.Editor.TypeSafeDataUnit.FileName
member.summary: The name of the file the generated class will be placed in. (Setting to YourName will result in YourName.Generated.cs). If null, ClassName will be used. Ignored if this is a nested data unit.

member.name: P:TypeSafe.Editor.TypeSafeDataUnit.DataType
member.summary: The Type of the data in your set. This should be a primitive, string or read-only class/struct in your own code.

member.name: P:TypeSafe.Editor.TypeSafeDataUnit.Data
member.summary: The data used to populate your generated class

member.name: P:TypeSafe.Editor.TypeSafeDataUnit.NestedUnits
member.summary: Data units that will be nested in this unit.

member.name: P:TypeSafe.Editor.TypeSafeDataUnit.EnableAllProperty
member.summary: If true, a property will be generated called "All" that will be a list of all the entries in your data set.

member.summary: Get a list of base class names used by TypeSafe

member.summary: Given a long error message in the format "{0} - {1}", return only {0}.

member.summary: Copy a collection of file paths to the deploy path and refresh the Unity asset database for the target files. This will check for file changes before copying to reduce unnecessary recompiles.
member.param: Number of files that have been updated.
If true, skip the actual copying of the file, just check for differences

member.summary: Remove all generated files from the Unity project directory

member.name: M:TypeSafe.Editor.TypeSafeUtil.ValidateTypeName(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Perform a full validation check on a type name, including checking for conflicts with existing non-TypeSafe classes.
member.param: The namespace that the class name will be placed in.
A prefix to apply to , or null
A suffix to apply to , or null
String will be populated with the error message if validation fails.
member.returns: True if validation succeeds, otherwise false.

member.summary: Remove any characters that are forbidden in a type name.

member.summary: Perform validation on a string as a type name.

member.returns: True if validation succeeded, overwise false. contains the error if false.

member.summary: Perform validation on a string as a namespace name.

member.returns: True if validation succeeded, overwise false. contains the error if false.
